intro: Pecluma ptilotos var. bourgeauana, commonly known as the Bourgeau's pecluma, is a rare and lesser-known variant of the pecluma genus. It is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa, typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-white in color, with delicate petals. Its leaves are broad and oval-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a botanically significant but under-researched species.
